metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3437 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was found in Samba within theGSSAPI unwrap_des() and unwrap_des3() routines of Heimdal. The DES andTriple-DES decryption routines in the Heimdal GSSAPI library allow alength-limited write buffer overflow on malloc() allocated memory whenpresented with a maliciously small packet. This flaw allows a remote userto send specially crafted malicious data to the application, possiblyresulting in a denial of service (DoS) attack.

criterions.comment: heimdal: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
